pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:0.5.eng: 12. The training rule on entirely black

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood near Vesālī,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were having blankets made entirely of black wool.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.3.pli: Manussā vihāracārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā passitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.3.eng: People who were walking about the dwellings complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpessanti, seyyathāpi gihī kāmabhogino”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.4.eng: “How could the Sakyan monastics have blankets made entirely of black wool? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.5.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.6.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.7.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six have blankets made entirely of black wool?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.8.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.8.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk has a blanket made entirely of black wool, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.6.eng: there are two kinds of black:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.9.eng: it is made by strewing, not by weaving.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.11.pli: karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.11.eng: if he makes the blanket, or has it made, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.12.eng: When he gets the blanket, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.13.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.13.eng: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.14.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.15.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.16.pli: “idaṃ me, bhante, suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.16.eng: ‘Venerables, this blanket, which I got made entirely of black wool, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.17.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.20.eng: ‘I give this blanket back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.21.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.21.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.22.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.22.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.23.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.23.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.24.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.24.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.25.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.25.eng: If he makes one, or has one made, for someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.26.pli: Aññena kataṃ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.26.eng: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.28.pli: vitānaṃ vā bhūmattharaṇaṃ vā sāṇipākāraṃ vā bhisiṃ vā bibbohanaṃ vā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.28.eng: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.30.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.31.eng: The training rule on entirely black, the second, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:0.5.eng: 13. The training rule on two parts

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—“bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpetun”ti, te thokaññeva odātaṃ ante ādiyitvā tatheva suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.2.eng: At that time, when the monks from the group of six knew that the Buddha had prohibited having a blanket made entirely of black wool, they added just a little bit of white on the edge, effectively having a blanket made entirely of black wool just as before.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū thokaññeva odātaṃ ante ādiyitvā tatheva suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.4.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.5.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, thokaññeva odātaṃ ante ādiyitvā tatheva suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.9.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, thokaññeva odātaṃ ante ādiyitvā tatheva suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.9.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.11.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.12.1.pli: “Navaṃ pana bhikkhunā santhataṃ kārayamānena dve bhāgā suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ ādātabbā tatiyaṃ odātānaṃ catutthaṃ gocariyānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.12.1.eng: ‘If a monk is having a new blanket made, he should use two parts of entirely black wool, a third part of white, and a fourth part of brown.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.13.pli: Anādā ce bhikkhu dve bhāge suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ tatiyaṃ odātānaṃ catutthaṃ gocariyānaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.13.eng: If he has a new blanket made without using two parts of entirely black wool, a third part of white, and a fourth part of brown, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.2.eng: newly made is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.4.eng: it is made by strewing, not by weaving.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.6.eng: making it himself or having it made.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.7.eng: He should use two parts of entirely black wool:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.8.eng: having weighed it, he should use two measures.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.13.pli: Anādā ce bhikkhu dve bhāge suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ tatiyaṃ odātānaṃ catutthaṃ gocariyānanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.13.eng: Without using two parts of entirely black wool, a third part of white, and a fourth part of brown:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.14.pli: Anādiyitvā dve tule suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ tulaṃ odātānaṃ tulaṃ gocariyānaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ karoti vā kārāpeti vā payoge dukkaṭaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.14.eng: if he makes it, or has it made, without using two measures of entirely black wool, one measure of white, and one measure of brown, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.15.eng: When he gets the blanket, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.16.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.16.eng: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.17.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.18.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.19.pli: “idaṃ me, bhante, santhataṃ anādiyitvā dve tule suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ tulaṃ odātānaṃ tulaṃ gocariyānaṃ kārāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.19.eng: ‘Venerables, this blanket, which I got made without using two measures of entirely black wool, one measure of white, and one measure of brown, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.20.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.23.eng: ‘I give this blanket back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.24.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.24.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.25.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.25.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.26.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.26.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.27.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.27.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.28.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.28.eng: If he makes one, or has one made, for someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.29.pli: Aññena kataṃ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.29.eng: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.31.pli: tulaṃ odātānaṃ tulaṃ gocariyānaṃ ādiyitvā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.31.eng: if he makes one using one measure of white and one measure of brown;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.32.pli: bahutaraṃ odātānaṃ bahutaraṃ gocariyānaṃ ādiyitvā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.32.eng: if he makes one using more than one measure of white and more than one measure of brown;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.33.pli: suddhaṃ odātānaṃ suddhaṃ gocariyānaṃ ādiyitvā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.33.eng: if he makes one using just white and brown;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.34.pli: vitānaṃ vā bhūmattharaṇaṃ vā sāṇipākāraṃ vā bhisiṃ vā bibbohanaṃ vā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.34.eng: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.36.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.37.eng: The training rule on two parts, the third, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:0.5.eng: 14. The training rule on six years

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū anuvassaṃ santhataṃ kārāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.2.eng: At that time monks were having blankets made every year.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.3.eng: They kept on begging and asking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā anuvassaṃ santhataṃ kārāpessanti, yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharissanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.7.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics have blankets made every year, begging and asking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.9.pli: Amhākaṃ pana sakiṃ katāni santhatāni pañcapi chapi vassāni honti, yesaṃ no dārakā uhadantipi ummihantipi undūrehipi khajjanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.9.eng: We only make blankets for ourselves every five or six years, even though our children defecate and urinate on them and they are eaten by rats.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.10.pli: Ime pana samaṇā sakyaputtiyā anuvassaṃ santhataṃ kārāpenti, yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharanti—

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.12.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.12.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.13.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.13.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.14.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū anuvassaṃ santhataṃ kārāpessanti, yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharissanti—

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.16.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū te anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.16.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.17.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū anuvassaṃ santhataṃ kārāpenti, yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.17.eng: “Is it true, monks, that there are monks who do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.21.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā anuvassaṃ santhataṃ kārāpessanti, yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharissanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.21.eng: “How can those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.24.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.24.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.25.1.pli: “Navaṃ pana bhikkhunā santhataṃ kārāpetvā chabbassāni dhāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.25.1.eng: ‘If a monk has had a new blanket made, he should keep it for six years.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.26.pli: Orena ce channaṃ vassānaṃ taṃ santhataṃ vissajjetvā vā avissajjetvā vā aññaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.26.eng: Whether that blanket has been given away or not, if he has another new blanket made in less than six years, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.27.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.27.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kosambiyaṃ gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.1.eng: At one time a certain monk at Kosambī was sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.2.pli: Ñātakā tassa bhikkhuno santike dūtaṃ pāhesuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.2.eng: His relatives sent him a message, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.7.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.8.pli: ‘navaṃ pana bhikkhunā santhataṃ kārāpetvā chabbassāni dhāretabban’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.8.eng: that a monk who has had a new blanket made must keep it for six years.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.9.pli: Ahañcamhi gilāno, na sakkomi santhataṃ ādāya pakkamituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.9.eng: Now because I’m sick, I’m unable to travel with my blanket.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.10.pli: Mayhañca vinā santhatā na phāsu hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.10.eng: And because I’m not comfortable without it,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.13.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.14.eng: “Monks, I allow you to give permission to a sick monk to make a blanket.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.14.comm: “Permission to make a blanket”, renders santhatasammuti. The literal meaning, “blanket permission”, is ambiguous in English.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.15.eng: And it should be given like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.16.pli: Tena gilānena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.16.eng: After approaching the Sangha, the sick monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.18.eng: I’m unable to travel with my blanket.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.19.eng: I ask the Sangha for permission to make a blanket.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.20.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.22.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.23.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.24.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu gilāno na sakkoti santhataṃ ādāya pakkamituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.24.eng: The monk so-and-so is sick. He’s unable to travel with his blanket.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.25.eng: He’s asking the Sangha for permission to make a blanket.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.26.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno santhatasammutiṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.26.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give permission to monk so-and-so to make a blanket.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.28.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.29.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu gilāno na sakkoti santhataṃ ādāya pakkamituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.29.eng: The monk so-and-so is sick. He’s unable to travel with his blanket.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.30.eng: He’s asking the Sangha for permission to make a blanket.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.31.eng: The Sangha gives permission to monk so-and-so to make a blanket.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.32.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno santhatasammutiyā dānaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.32.eng: Any monk who approves of giving permission to monk so-and-so to make a blanket should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.33.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.34.eng: The Sangha has given permission to monk so-and-so to make a blanket.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.35.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.37.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.37.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.38.1.pli: “Navaṃ pana bhikkhunā santhataṃ kārāpetvā chabbassāni dhāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.38.1.eng: ‘If a monk has had a new blanket made, he should keep it for six years.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.39.pli: Orena ce channaṃ vassānaṃ taṃ santhataṃ vissajjetvā vā avissajjetvā vā aññaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.39.eng: Whether that blanket has been given away or not, if he has another new blanket made in less than six years, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.2.eng: newly made is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.4.eng: it is made by strewing, not by weaving.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.6.eng: has made or has had made.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.7.eng: He should keep it for six years:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.8.eng: he should keep it for six years at a minimum.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.8.comm: “At a minimum” renders paramatā, which normally means “at a maximum”. Yet paramatā also means “in the extreme” and thus in the present case “at a minimum”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.11.eng: That blanket has been given away:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.12.eng: it has been given to others.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.14.eng: it has not been given to anyone.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.15.eng: Except if the monks have agreed:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.16.pli: ṭhapetvā bhikkhusammutiṃ aññaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.16.eng: if he makes another new blanket, or has one made, unless the monks have agreed, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.17.eng: When he gets the blanket, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.18.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.18.eng: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.19.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.20.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.21.pli: “idaṃ me, bhante, santhataṃ ūnakachabbassāni kārāpitaṃ, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.21.eng: ‘Venerables, this blanket, which I got made after less than six years without the agreement of the monks, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.22.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.25.eng: ‘I give this blanket back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.26.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.26.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.27.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.27.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.28.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.28.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.29.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.29.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.31.eng: if he makes one after six years;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.32.eng: if he makes one after more than six years;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.33.eng: if he makes one, or has one made, for the sake of another;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.34.eng: if he gets what was made by another and then uses it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.35.pli: vitānaṃ vā bhūmattharaṇaṃ vā sāṇipākāraṃ vā bhisiṃ vā bibbohanaṃ vā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.35.eng: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.36.eng: if he has the permission of the monks;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.38.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.39.eng: The training rule on six years, the fourth, is finished.
